column4: I have a question: I have a laptop that has a subwoofer and the volume isnt nearly as loud as it was on windows.. how do i go about fixing this?
have you visited the volume options?
you mean the Alsa mixer?
well yes, but have you been into prefs there and enabled all of your other channels?
a lot of them will be disabled and set to zero be default
which device do I use?
can I PM you?
right click on your volume icon, and choose prefs, then enable all your devices
sure
yes, you just need to specify it in your config
for the virtualbox i mean
its running tinyxp
so I would need to shut the VB down first to change that configuration?
yes you do. then you can map it in the virtual machines networking options
easy ;)
k Ill give that a shot thanks, brb
you still in here?
yeah
did u win?
hey I cant find the shared folder though.. for some reason
did u navigate to your machine correctly? try IP if hostname isnt working
one sec.. lemme shut down and verify the path
the path is /home/dividebyzer0/.VirtualBox/Machines/TinyXP
